issue.title: FIX `oversampling>0` in `ScatteringBase1D.scattering`

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body: Triggers and fixes a bug in `oversampling>0` (non-default), introduced by #937 a few days ago.

issue.title: ENH JTFS `_check_runtime_args`

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body:
The beginning of `TimeFrequencyScatteringBase.scattering` will be:

```python
def scattering(self, x):
    TimeFrequencyScatteringBase._check_runtime_args(self)
    TimeFrequencyScatteringBase._check_input(self, x)

    x_shape = self.backend.shape(x)
    batch_shape, signal_shape = x_shape[:-1], x_shape[-1:]
    x = self.backend.reshape_input(x, signal_shape)
    U_0 = self.backend.pad(x, pad_left=self.pad_left, pad_right=self.pad_right)
```

This PR adds the checks for `average_fr`, `oversampling_fr`, and `out_types`.
the out_types i am anticipating are:
* 2D: batch, path, time (just like Scattering1D). includes zeroth order
* 3D: batch, second-order path, frequency, time. excludes zeroth order
* array: tries 3D if possible, otherwise falls back to 2D (this will be the default)
* dict: keys will be () at zeroth order, (n1,) at first order, and (n1, (n2, n_fr)) at second order. the unspinned phi-psi pair will be represented by n2=-1.
* list: all paths concatenated, including metadata.

2D requires T≠0 (i.e. some form of averaging, whether local or global)
3D requires both T≠0 and F≠0.

~Note that i am not anticipating `oversampling='full'` or `oversampling_fr='full'`, which may allow 3D concatenation despite T=0 and/or F=0. This might come as a later feature if someone requests it, but i don't want to complicate the runtime logic too much at this stage.~ (see #937)

issue.title: ENH JTFS `joint_timefrequency_scattering`

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body:
Segue of #935.

This PR implements the joint time-frequency scattering algorithm (JTFS) of Andén, L., and Mallat (2015).
The implementation is complete is that it includes conjugate ("spinned") wavelets, mixed bandpass/lowpass pairs ("psi-phi"), and a customizable frequential filterbank through `Q_fr` and `J_fr`. The implementation is backend-agnostic.

However, temporal and frequential averaging are not yet supported, and the formatting is "3D" (concatenated in frequency) for now. I will provide functions for `temporal_averaging`, `frequential_averaging`, and `split` in later PR's, to allow other formats. We will also have to run a `DryBackend` through this function in order to obtain an automatic `jtfs.meta()` (in the spirit of #893) and `jtfs.output_size()`.

Thanks to previous PR's #923 (merged) and #935 (under review), the core function ends up being very short: six lines of code, and a single for loop.

```python
def joint_timefrequency_scattering(U_0, backend, filters, oversampling,
         average_local, filters_fr, oversampling_fr, average_local_fr):
    time_gen = time_scattering_widthfirst(U_0, backend, filters, oversampling, average_local)
    yield next(time_gen)
    S_1 = next(time_gen)
    yield from frequency_scattering(S_1, backend,
        filters_fr, average_local_fr, oversampling_fr, spinned=False)
    for Y_2 in time_gen:
        yield from frequency_scattering(Y_2, backend,
            filters_fr, average_local_fr, oversampling_fr, spinned=True)
```

I have added comments to explain the role of each line above. I have also added various tests to check metadata and array sizes. Once we have a proper frontend to call this (in the continuation of #928 and #931), it would be good to add tests which analyze the response of this JTFS operator on synthetic data.

Tagging @cyrusvahidi and @MuawizChaudhary for code review :)

body:
Following today's meeting, we've decided to put this plan in action.
I'm working towards a PR

issue.title: MAINT `oversampling` --> `stride`, immutable `Q` and `T`

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body:
Fixes #937 

I have written the smallest PR possible
In a separate PR i will rewrite core 1D in terms of log2_stride instead of oversampling. But that's not necessary right now.

~~Note that stride is passed at runtime, not in the constructor. This allows to change stride between inputs without recomputing the filters.~~  actually no because this causes problem in autodiff

Should be reviewed and merged before v0.4

I will also make a PR about `stride_fr` later
